meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tactile.
meanings.sent1: I love the tactility of soft fabrics like velvet.
meanings.sent2: The artist's sculpture emphasized tactility, inviting viewers to touch it.
meanings.sent3: The kitten explored the room with curiosity, experiencing the tactility of different surfaces.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a tactility that reached out and touched the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The tactility of the rough bark on the tree made it feel like a living being.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive through touch.
meanings.sent1: His job required a high level of tactility to distinguish between textures.
meanings.sent2: The blindfolded person relied on tactility to navigate the obstacle course.
meanings.sent3: The robot's advanced tactility allowed it to handle delicate objects with precision.
meanings.sent4: In the dark room, she relied on tactility to find her way to the door.
meanings.sent5: The tactility of the braille alphabet enables visually impaired individuals to read through touch.
